headline.main: RESEARCHERS FIND ACID RAIN IMPERILS FORESTS OVER TIME

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Acid rain appears to pose a long-term threat to forests, but ozone and natural causes of stress are also implicated in forest decline and may be more harmful to trees in the short run, scientists in a Federal research program have found.
